section.title: Overview
section.para: The time needed when writing a new OpenSIPS module unfortunately is quite high, while the options provided by the configuration file are limited to the features implemented in the modules.
With this Lua module, you can easily implement your own OpenSIPS extensions in Lua.

section.title: Installing the module
section.para: This Lua module is loaded in opensips.cfg (just like all the other modules) with loadmodule("/path/to/lua.so");.
For the Lua module to compile, you need a recent version of Lua (tested with 5.1) linked dynamically. The default version of your favorite Linux distribution should work fine.

section.title: Using the module
section.para: With the Lua module, you can access to lua function on the OpenSIPS side. You need to define a file to load and call a function from it. Write a function "mongo_alias" and then write in your opensips.cfg ... if (lua_exec("mongo_alias")) { ... } ...
On the Lua side, you have access to opensips functions and variables (AVP, pseudoVar, ...). Read the documentation below for further informations.

section.title: OpenSIPS Modules
section.para: None ;-)

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running OpenSIPS with this module loaded:
Lua 5.1.x or later
memcached
This module has been developed and tested with Lua 5.1.?, but should work with any 5.1.x release. Earlier versions do not work.

On current Debian systems, at least the following packages should be installed:
lua5.1
liblua5.1-0-dev
libmemcached-dev
libmysqlclient-dev
It was reported that other Debian-style distributions (such as Ubuntu) need the same packages.

On OpenBSD systems, at least the following packages should be installed:
Lua

section.title: luafilename (string)
section.para: This is the file name of your script. This may be set once only, but it may include an arbitary number of functions and "use" as many Lua module as necessary.
The default value is "/etc/opensips/opensips.lua"

section.title: lua_auto_reload (int)
section.para: Define this value to 1 if you want to reload automatically the lua script. Disabled by default.

section.title: warn_missing_free_fixup (int)
section.para: When you call a function via moduleFunc() you could have a memleak. Enable this warns you when you're doing it. Enabled by default.

section.title: lua_allocator (string)
section.para:
Change the default memory allocator for the lua module. Possible values are :
opensips (default)
malloc

section.title: lua_user_debug (int)
section.para: Disable by default

section.title: lua_exec(func, [param])
section.para: Calls a Lua function with passing it the current SIP message. This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE, ONREPLY_ROUTE and BRANCH_ROUTE.
Parameters:

listitem.para: param (string, optional) - Parameter to be passed to the Lua function.

section.title: lua_meminfo()
section.para: Logs informations about memory.
Name: watch
Parameters: none

listitem.para: extension (optional) - required if action is provided
